title: Finding a font's manufacturer
content:
I'm trying to determine the manufacturer of a font I've used in a particular project on behalf of a client. They would like to purchase a license and use the same exact font in designing materials in-house. Does anyone know how to track done such info on a font you've been using forever and have no idea where you purchased it?

Thanks!
author: grafxgrly

comments.content: Assuming you don't have font editing software, if you're using Windows XP+, you can right-click the font and get the copyright information under the "Details" tab." That should set you in the right direction...
...and if you're on a Mac computer, select the font file and press the "Command" and "I" keys to "Get info"... You should see the manufacturer's name listed under "Version."
